details.flavorText:
Blue dragons are the sleek and poised cosmopolitans of the chromatic dragons. Their brand of evil is organized, manipulative, and regal. Blue dragons often lair near or within cities and set out to bend the population to their will and gather hordes of servants. These dragons love spinning webs of conspiracy. A blue dragon's lackeys typically don't even realize that they serve a dragon, but instead think the protection money, tariffs, or taxes they are amassing is treasure for a cruel but legitimate master. In some ways, blue dragons even see their servants as a living hoard and value them like treasure. These dragons have been known to use these tactics even with their own chromatic cousins.

Not all blue dragons work clandestinely. Some lord over desert tribes and hill people like vengeful gods, demanding both tribute and worship. No matter how blue dragons manage their underlings, their bearing is regal and their lairs palatial; they're universally intolerant of insubordination, incompetence, and embezzlement, and punish perpetrators with murderous efficiency.

Blue dragons are also known for their use and mastery of illusion magic. They make use of illusions to augment their manipulations and bewilder their foes in battle. Blue dragons also have some control over water, but use this ability to destroy water, something quite dangerous for those who encounter them in their desert lairs.

The ideal lair for a blue dragon contains multiple passages, rooms, and secret chambers. As social creatures, blue dragons prefer to host guests in comfort-but their dwellings should not be so public that just anyone can come calling. A force of guards keeps out intruders, and clever illusions conceal the edifice from prying eyes. Rather than a pile of coins or gems, a blue dragon's true hoard is the rich furnishings in its citadel- expensive art, ornate furniture, and architectural marvels.
details.sidebarText:
Blue Dragon Spellcasters

Blue dragon spellcasters tend to cast the following spells.

Young Blue Dragon
Arcane Prepared Spells DC 28, attack +21; 4th @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Dimension Door]{Dimension Door}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Hallucinatory Terrain]{Hallucinatory Terrain}; 3rd dream message, hypnotic pattern, paralyze; 2nd dispel magic, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Invisibility]{Invisibility}, mirror image; 1st alarm, charm, unseen servant; Cantrips @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Detect Magic]{Detect Magic}, message, read aura, shield, sigil

description.value: As you cup your hands, water begins to flow forth from them. You create 2 gallons of water. If no one drinks it, it evaporates after 1 day.

You create an auditory illusion of simple sounds that has a maximum volume equal to four normal humans shouting. The sounds emanate from a square you designate within range. You can't create intelligible words or other intricate sounds (such as music).

Heightened The range increases to 60 feet.

Heightened The range increases to 120 feet.
The dragon can mimic any sound it has heard. It must succeed at a Deception check with a +4 circumstance bonus to do so.

90 feet, DC 26
A creature that first enters the area must attempt a Will save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this monster's Frightful Presence for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected by the presence.
Success The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened} 1.
Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened} 2.
Critical Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened} 4.

Trigger The dragon is targeted with an attack. Effect The dragon raises its wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the dragon is Flying, it descends 10 feet after the attack is complete.
The dragon breathes lightning that deals [[/r 5d12 # electricity damage]] electricity damage in an 80-foot line (basic Reflex save). It can't use Breath Weapon again for 1d4 rounds.

When casting @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Create Water]{Create Water}, the dragon can attempt to destroy liquid instead of creating it, turning an equal amount of liquid into sand. This destroys liquid magic or alchemical items if they're of a lower level than the dragon (a creature can attempt a Will save to protect all liquids in its possession). This doesn't affect the liquids in a creature's body.
The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one horns Strike in any order.
The dragon recharges its Breath Weapon whenever it scores a critical hit with a Strike.
